page.title: 04SPECIALISED EQUIPMENT (a)
page.content: Much specialised equipment is used in the hospital, (a) for diagnosis and (b) for treatment.{ {The X-ray unit}contains modern remote controlled equipment including an image intensifier which simulates treatment and can take many photographs of one particular area.{ {There is also a C.A.T.(Computerised {Axle Tomography) scanner}which is capable of exceptional definition and accuracy and which investigates areas of the body previously inaccessible to radiological equipment. The images are stored on floppy discs and there is a viewing room where these images are enlarged.{ {In the Coronary Department}heartbeats of patients are monitored continually. Coronary patients en route to hospital by ambulance can be monitored at the hospital while still in transit.
